title: Fred Phelps
summary: Fred Waldron Phelps Sr. (November 13, 1929 – March 19, 2014[1][2]) was an American minister and disbarred attorney who served as pastor of the Westboro Baptist Church and became known for his extreme views against homosexuality and protests near the funerals of gay people, military veterans, and disaster victims who he believed were killed as a result of God punishing the U.S. for having "bankrupt values" and tolerating homosexuality.
